kpis.value: Attendance Growth: Increase event attendance from 50% to 80% (target audience) by end of 2025.
Active Participation: Ensure 20% of QA members actively participate (measured via points).
Solutions Contribution: Deliver at least 3 solutions/practices to R&D/Business initiatives by 2025.
Idea Generation: Contribute 2 ideas to Bubble by end of 2025.
Cross-Studio Workshops: Facilitate 2 workshops/year to solve key challenges.
Cost-Saving Initiatives: Implement at least 1 AI-driven efficiency improvements by EOY.
Top Contributor Recognition: Launch Top Contributor Award twice a year.
Decrease average testing cycle duration by 2.5% each quarter, starting with Q3.
Implement prioritization framework to ensure that 80% of critical test cases are covered in initial test runs.
Increased by 10% defect detection via AI and/or automation tools.
Improved stakeholder satisfaction with 10% by the end of 2025 â€“ measured with quarterly satisfaction surveys.
Automate at least 1 repetitive manual flow.
Reduce manual testing hours by implementing 1 automated solution.
Activity points accrued by 50% of members.
20% of participants demonstrating growth in AI by providing ideas or implementations.
40% of members will complete a certification
Resource Sharing and Process Adoption: QAs using at least 3 high-value resources/tools by the end of 2025
Knowledge Sharing Events: Host at least 6 events by end of 2025

agenda.title: Tool Comparison: Internal vs Testomat vs Others

Implement prioritization framework to ensure that 80% of critical test cases are covered in initial test runs.

matched_kpis.kpi:
Nr. of sessions per year: Count all knowledge-sharing sessions held annually.
→ ≥6 → consistent sharing culture.
→ <6 → need to schedule more sessions or rotate speakers.

Nr. of case studies: Count documented/presented case studies (problem → solution → result).
→ ≥4 → strong knowledge documentation culture.
→ <2 → encourage reflection and write-ups.
matched_kpis.explanation: Match on: case. Related to agenda: „AI Internal Test Case Generator”.

matched_kpis.kpi:
Nr. of innovative topics including AI: Count sessions introducing new tools, AI, automation, or QA innovations.
→ ≥4 → proactive innovation mindset.
→ <2 → increase exploration of new technologies.

Nr. of POCs initiated from clan topics: Track ideas from sessions that become proof-of-concepts or pilots.
→ ≥1 → discussions generate real impact.
→ 0 → innovation remains theoretical; push for implementation.

rubric.key: Clarity of Argument – Were the points expressed clearly and logically?
rubric.label: Clarity

rubric.key: Evidence & Reasoning – Did the team support their claims with strong logic, examples, or data?
rubric.label: Evidence & Reasoning

rubric.key: Relevance – Did the arguments stay focused on the debate topic and the round’s theme?
rubric.label: Relevance

rubric.key: Persuasiveness – How convincing was the team in defending its position and responding to counterarguments?
rubric.label: Persuasiveness

rubric.key: Delivery & Structure – Was the speech well-organized, engaging, and within the time limits?
rubric.label: Delivery & Structure

rounds.description:
Focus on / hints:
- Test Quality & Coverage
- Productivity & Risks
rounds.title: Round 1

rounds.description:
Focus on / hints:
- Research & Implementation
- Feasibility of Adoption in the near-future
rounds.title: Round 2

rounds.description:
Focus on:
- summarize to sell your story to convince jury and public to vote you
rounds.title: Final wrap up

rounds.description: Analyze the practical challenges of adopting each approach, including the time and resources needed to identify the right solutions, integration into existing workflows, training requirements, and the risks of rushing versus the benefits of early experimentation.
rounds.title: Research & Implementation

questions.title: How satisfied are you with the professional level of the instructor ?
How relevant and applicable was the content for you ?

Any suggestions or additional feedback

answers.q_50q0y2f: Great session, keep em coming. Also, can't wait for the debates!
Provide udemy accounts in order to start suggested courses
maybe don't start a general interest topic (rewarding system) without enough time, don't hand out rewards without them being already discussed and stuff like that. Good job for the Caesars AQA lead
I already had some of the basics of automation and was looking for something a bit more in depth. Real situations and how to have everything set up
was not present because of incident in Production and release

questions.title: Which topics should we deep-dive into at the next clan session? (Top 5)
options: Code Without Caution: AI's Path to the Next Digital Disaster
Value, Money, and Costs: The Ultimate Common Language for the Testing Strategy
Large Action Models Are Coming For Your Testing Frameworks! - Large Action Models (LAMs), the upgrade to Large Language Models (LLMs)
Measuring Performance with Functional Tests: A Low-Effort Approach for High Impact
Shifting Left & Speeding Up: A QA-Led Transformation
Practical LLM Evals: Down-to-Earth Tooling for Everyone - practical ways to use LLMs and open-source tools for smarter, more consistent software testing and QA evaluations.
Exploratory Load-Testing with AI Tooling – It’s time to Ramp Up! (not really, just predefined tests with clear steps ran using an AI tool)
It's Inevitable, Mr. Anderson: Machines, Humans, and the Future of Testing – AI commercialization
The Real Impact of AI in Software Testing – what worked, changed and how teams adapted to the AI tech.
Defining “DevExT”, the Developer Experience in Testing
How to Create Your QA Dream Team Structure – how to build a strong team in accordance with people’s personalities.
A Quality Hero Complex (about balance, burnout & learning to say “No!”)
One Strategy, One Community: A Deep Dive into a Global Testing Transformation – dream planning, harder to do in established projects without push from the top
The Better Quality Movement - How We Can Advocate for a Better Digital World
Game Theory and the Art of Teamwork in Software Development – test teamwork through games
Zen-Driven Development - Protect Your Sanity – tips to keep your mind free of worry and stress (cannot guarantee success).
Navigating the Testing Wilderness: Mind Maps and AI as Your Trusted Compass – how to plan and view through images
How John Started to Like TDD (Instead of hating it)
Test-First Development with AI as Your Pair Programmer – TTD but with multiple AI checking the code, a review to a review
Strategic Business Functionality Testing: Accelerating Development Through Mocking – find the tools that fit your project

kpis.name: Nr. of sessions per year
kpis.how_to_measure:
Count all knowledge-sharing sessions held annually.
→ ≥6 → consistent sharing culture.
→ <6 → need to schedule more sessions or rotate speakers.

kpis.name: Feedback (survey)
kpis.how_to_measure:
Collect post-session surveys (1–5 usefulness rating).
→ ≥4/5 → sessions are engaging and valuable.
→ <3.5 → improve content relevance or delivery

kpis.name: Nr. of case studies
kpis.how_to_measure:
Count documented/presented case studies (problem → solution → result).
→ ≥4 → strong knowledge documentation culture.
→ <2 → encourage reflection and write-ups.

kpis.name: Survey feedback
kpis.how_to_measure:
Psychological safety survey twice a year (comfort in speaking up, asking questions).
→ ≥4 → healthy, open culture.
→ <3.5 → improve trust and feedback environment.

kpis.name: Nr. of active members per session
kpis.how_to_measure:
Track % of participants who speak, ask, or share feedback per session.
→ ≥40% → strong engagement.
→ <25% → sessions are too passive; need more interaction.

kpis.name: Presentation / communication skills rating
kpis.how_to_measure:
Collect peer ratings on clarity, structure, delivery after each presentation.
→ ≥4 → effective presentation skills.
→ <3.5 → need presentation coaching.

kpis.name: Subjective survey
kpis.how_to_measure:
Semiannual self-assessment on confidence and communication improvement.
→ ≥4 or +0.5 → visible personal growth.
→ <3.5 → encourage skill-focused feedback or mentoring.

kpis.name: Attendance growth (positive QoQ)
kpis.how_to_measure:
Compare average attendance per quarter.
→ Positive growth → stronger interest and visibility.
→ Negative trend → sessions need better promotion or topics.

kpis.name: Familiarity with clan activities
kpis.how_to_measure:
Internal survey on awareness of QA Clan’s purpose and work.
→ ≥70% → strong brand awareness.
→ <50% → improve internal communication and visibility.

kpis.name: Nr. of innovative topics including AI
kpis.how_to_measure:
Count sessions introducing new tools, AI, automation, or QA innovations.
→ ≥4 → proactive innovation mindset.
→ <2 → increase exploration of new technologies.

kpis.name: Nr. of POCs initiated from clan topics
kpis.how_to_measure:
Track ideas from sessions that become proof-of-concepts or pilots.
→ ≥1 → discussions generate real impact.
→ 0 → innovation remains theoretical; push for implementation.
